dialogues.text: About himself. No one knows. No one but me. Jon isn't really my father's son. He's the son of Rhaegar Targaryen and my aunt, Lyanna Stark. Sam stares at Bran for a long beat. What he’s just heard, true, is news that changes everything. Bran looks away.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: He was born in a tower in Dorne. His last name isn’t really Snow. It’s Sand. Sam puts everything together. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: It’s not. Bran’s not truly capable of surprise anymore, but he’s confused now.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Dornish bastards are named Sand.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: At the Citadel, I transcribed a High Septon’s diary. (beat) He annulled Rhaegar’s marriage to Elia. This is something Bran didn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: He wed Rhaegar and Lyanna, in a secret ceremony. Close on Bran, as he realizes what this means.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Are you certain? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 56.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: It’s what the High Septon wrote in his private diary. I don’t know why he’d lie. Is this something you can see? We go extremely close on Bran, his eyes wide open. When we pull back, we realize we’re no longer in Bran’s r We're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bran watches RHAEGAR TARGARYEN, silver-haired, tall and handsome. He stands by LYANNA STARK, both of them nervous but happy. Lyanna looks up into Rhaegar’s eyes as HIGH SEPTON MAYNAR binds their hands with the wedding wrap in a ceremony tha should look quite similar to the marriage of Robb Stark a Talisa. Their love for each other would be obvious to any bystand Bran stands close by, watching them say the words:

dialogues.speaker: RHAEGAR LYANNA
dialogues.text: Father. Smith. Warrior. Father. Smith. Warrior. Mother. Maiden. Crone. Mother. Maiden. Crone. Stranger. I am hers, and she Stranger. I am his, and he i is mine, from this day, until mine, from this day, until the end of my days. the end of my days.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Robert’s Rebellion was built on a lie. The two young lovers kiss, hopeful newlyweds who truly believe this will all work out.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rhaegar didn't kidnap my aunt, or rape her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand closes into a fist before a carved wooden door. A beautiful door, fit for a queen. The hand raises: Jon’s hand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 57.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He loved her. Jon hesitates for a beat. He knocks. A moment later Dany opens the door and stares at him. For a moment they just look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And she loved him. Then Dany stands aside and Jon enters the room. At the far end of the corridor, Tyrion watches from the stairway, and sees Dany’s door closing behind Jon Snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyanna in bed, bleeding, with Young Ned beside her, in th shots from Season 6, but this time Bran stands right next the bed, close enough to hear Lyanna whisper.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And Jon... Jon’s real name...

dialogues.speaker: LYANNA
dialogues.text: His name is Aegon Targaryen. You have to protect him. Promise me, Ned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We crawl up the swirling bedclothes to Dany and Jon, making love. Jon is on top.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s never been a bastard. Their faces are inches apart. Their eyes are wide open.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He’s the heir to the Iron Throne. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrion watches Dany’s closed door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Looking troubled for more reasons than one, he turns away enters his own cabin and shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He needs to know.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need to tell him. Dany's ship makes its way north, toward White Harbor, the dragon-emblazoned sails fluttering in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has passed. Sansa and Arya look out across the snowy landscape. Arya looks up at her big sister.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Sansa nods.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: It’s just strange. (beat) In his own horrible way, I believe he loved me. Arya shrugs. She doesn’t have any angst about it.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: You did it.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I’m just the executioner. You passed the sentence. You’re the Lady of Winterfell. Sansa glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Does that bother you? Arya shakes her head. Nope. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 59.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I was never going to be as good a lady as you. So I had to be something else. (beat) I never could have survived what you survived.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: You would have. You’re the strongest person I know. Arya looks at her big sister again.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I believe that’s the nicest thing you've ever said to me.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Well. Don’t get used to it. You’re still very strange and annoying. Arya smiles. She stares north with Sansa.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: In winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa knows those words.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Father. Arya nods. He said it all so many times, they know it by heart.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives. They are silent for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Me too. We crane up and away from the Stark sisters.  GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We crane down from the weirwood's leaves to find Bran sit at the base of the tree, his eyes rolled back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, we fly to the Wall with a flock of birds, pilo by Bran. A bunch of them land on the Wall battlements abo Eastwatch. TORMUND walks the battlements, gazing north for the enemy knows is coming. He looks down the battlements to BERIC, who is up here wi him, along with a few other WILDLINGS. They’ve all taken to the strange role of serving as guardians of the Wall.

dialogues.speaker: BERIC
dialogues.text: It’s a long way down.

dialogues.speaker: TORMUND
dialogues.text: Eh. Crows keep telling me I’1l get used to it. A few NIGHT’S WATCHMEN are up here as well. Tormund hears a strange sound, getting louder. He looks d to the north side of the Wall. Beric looks as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging from the frozen coastal forest, the ARMY OF THE comes in force. All of them, 100,000 strong, with hundred WHITE WALKER officer corps on their dead horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Night’s Watchmen runs to the large horn and bl three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army of the Dead halts in the no-man’s-land between t forest and the Wall, the Walkers on their dead horses in front of the wight foot soldiers. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: “The Dragon and the Wolf" 61. Tormund exhales, looks to Beric. It's true, that whole th about them being unable to pass the Wall because of ancie spells and such. He’ll live another day. But then a stranger sound comes from the north. Tormund l to the sky, and sees a mote on the horizon, coming in fas Very fast. It's moving so fast we don't get a clear look at it or th NIGHT KING on its back before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it is upon us...

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: ..-hitting the Wall with a blast of blue flame. Bran's meaningful birds take flight. A massive chunk of the Wall breaks free ahead of Tormund. ice dragon glides away, and we get our first clear look a him, and at the Night King on his back. He's done the same thing to Viserion that he did to Craster's sons. Only tho were babies, and this is a dragon.

dialogues.speaker: TORMUND
dialogues.text: (shouting a command) Run! Run! Tormund and Beric lead their wildling comrades to the sta carved in the ice -- Eastwatch has a massive zig-zag stairway, not an elevator like Castle Black. They run for their lives and disappear from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Night King and his dragon kill. Hovering near the base of the forth a steady stream of blue strafing back and forth along The Wall cannot withstand the

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: circle back, coming in for the Wall, the ice dragon shoots fire, thick as a tree trunk, the base of the Wall. fire. Thunderously, it begins to give way, sending pieces falling into the sea like a calving iceberg. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES “The Dragon and the Wolf" 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see a few Wildling stragglers who didn’t make it down time fall hundreds of feet to their death. The ice dragon keeps blasting until a huge breach has bee opened, one large enough to admit the Army of the Dead, a 100,000 of them. And the White Walkers. And the Night Kin flying low over their heads, into the camera -- -- and away from it. All of them heading south, for the w of men.
